meanings.definition: Having the most elasticity or bounce.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was the springiest of all, stretching easily.
meanings.sent2: The mattress felt the springiest out of all the beds in the store.
meanings.sent3: The springiest trampoline in the park was always the most popular with the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the springiest sound in the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The springiest ball in the basket bounced the highest, surprising everyone.

meanings.definition: Showing the most energy or liveliness.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was the springiest of all, running around the yard with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The children at the party were the springiest, dancing and playing games.
meanings.sent3: The springiest squirrel in the park entertained everyone with its acrobatics.
meanings.sent4: Her springiest performance on stage captivated the entire audience.
meanings.sent5: The springiest flower in the garden seemed to dance in the breeze, full of life.

meanings.sent1: The springiest door in the house always closed with a loud bang.
meanings.sent2: The ball was the springiest, rebounding off the wall with great force.
meanings.sent3: The springiest toy car zoomed back after hitting the obstacle, surprising the child.
meanings.sent4: His spirit was the springiest, always recovering swiftly from setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The springiest branch on the tree snapped back into place after being bent by the wind.
